pr_title: Link the Download and Install Section of the README File to B.io

timeline.message: Update the Download and Install section

timeline.bodyText: Why we are removing installing from the source from Readme file? That information is not there in https://ballerina.io/learn/installing-ballerina/. So from where users can get this details?

replies.bodyText:
This PR is to add that info to the "Installing Ballerina" page.
ballerina-platform/ballerina-dev-website#215
replies.author: praneesha

replies.bodyText: That information is already there in https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-dev-website/blob/master/contribution-guide.md with more details. So with this PR are we going to duplicate the same information in both places. IMO, it is not correct. The content in the both places are having different information even right now. If we really want to have it in web site then we need to have a fully descriptive separate page on building from source. (see go for example https://golang.org/doc/install/source)
replies.author: anupama-pathirage

replies.bodyText:
IMHO, since we have a simple and straightforward way to build the source, we will not need a separate page for the topic "Installing from Source ATM like in Go. Therefore, merged the content that was there in the Contribution Guide to the "Installing from source" section in the "Installing Ballerina" page via ballerina-platform/ballerina-dev-website#215.
Now, both the Contribution Guide in B.io and README file in the ballerina-lang repo links to the "Installing from source" section in the "Installing Ballerina" via ballerina-platform/ballerina-dev-website#215.
replies.author: praneesha
